summary: Clindamycin is a powerful antibiotic that fights various bacterial infections. It's used for serious conditions like bone infections, pneumonia, and skin issues like acne. This medicine can be taken as a pill, injection, or applied as a cream/gel. Common side effects include nausea, diarrhea, and skin rashes. It's important to use it only when needed, as it can increase the risk of a specific type of gut infection. First made in 1966, it's now widely available and commonly prescribed.
title: Clindamycin
